body:
Please provide further details, what API endpoints are you using and with what parameters? (When importing, when spidering, etc)

In general it is best to get things working as you intend in the GUI then recreate that flow with the API. You can even run in GUI mode and execute with API then you can see what's going on.

If all of you're endpoints are within a part of the path (eg: example.com/API/endpoint1, etc) and you're starting point is example.com or /API then yes you have to recurse as the targets are "below" the starting point.
I am not using any API clients.  The problem: The spider is taking Imported URLs as input when i do it in GUI but not in the API((_http://127.0.0.1:8081/..._)

@breakthesec you've told us that is works via the UI but not the API, so you must be using the API. We need to know which API calls you are using - it _could_ be a bug in ZAP but its possible that you are using the API incorrectly. Until we know what API calls you are making we cant tell which it is.

I meant i am not using any API clients(like zap-api-java library), i am using the ZAP API from the browser.

**This is API call i made for spidering(i gave various input to recurse param):**
Importing the urls as input:
http://127.0.0.1:8081/JSON/importurls/action/importurls/?zapapiformat=JSON&apikey=[API_KEY]&formMethod=GET&filePath=[FILE_PATH]

Starting the Spidering:
http://127.0.0.1:8081/JSON/spider/action/scan/?zapapiformat=JSON&apikey=[API_KEY]&formMethod=GET&url=http://172.18.0.80:8080/JavaVulnerableLab/&maxChildren=&recurse=&contextName=&subtreeOnly=

View the crawled URLs in:
http://127.0.0.1:8081/JSON/spider/view/fullResults/?zapapiformat=JSON&apikey=[API_KEY]&formMethod=GET&scanId=0

(or)

http://127.0.0.1:8081/JSON/spider/view/allUrls/?zapapiformat=JSON&apikey=[API_KEY]&formMethod=GET

If the spider (through the API) is not picking the existing URLs it means the starting URL does not match an existing URL (under Sites tree). Are you also importing (or accessing) `http://172.18.0.80:8080/JavaVulnerableLab/`?

@thc202 Hi,  yes i imported urls under the JavaVulnerableLab only .

**For example, this is the imported URLs:**
http://172.18.0.80:8080/JavaVulnerableLab/vulnerability/Injection/xpath_login.jsp
http://172.18.0.80:8080/JavaVulnerableLab/vulnerability/idor/download.jsp
http://172.18.0.80:8080/JavaVulnerableLab/vulnerability/xss/search.jsp

**and this is the URLs i gave for spidering:**
http://172.18.0.80:8080/JavaVulnerableLab/

**It is working in GUI(right click and select spider) but not in API(from the browser).**
But was http://172.18.0.80:8080/JavaVulnerableLab/ itself ever visited or imported?
Yes, i have accessed the main url( http://172.18.0.80:8080/JavaVulnerableLab/) using the '/core/action/accessUrl/' call.   Now also tried to include this in import url list, still not working.
Yes, there's a usability issue here. The spider API is trying to obtain (always) a GET node instead of the "directory" as such it does not include the other child nodes/paths.

issue.title: Prefer dir node when recursing with spider API

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change SpiderAPI to try to get a directory node if recursing, to include
the child nodes as seeds.

Fix #4202 - API Spider call not taking ImportedUrls as input

issue.title: Add own URLs in sites tree and spider using API methods

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
**Description**
In order to find more pages, before spidering, I want to add my own URLs that can't be found by crawling the web pages. And I want to do this only with the web API (no user interface).

My website structure would be like this:

`main_page`
`main_page/secret.html`
`main_page/more_secrets.html`

`main_page` has no reference to `secret.html` or `more_secrets.html`
`secret.html` has references to `more_secrets.html`
(by references I mean HTML anchor tags)

**To Reproduce**
I want to manually add `main_page/secret.html` (in ZAP's URL tree) and then use spider on main_page.
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. `core/accessUrl` for `main_page/secret.html`
2. `spider/scan` for `main_page`

**Expected behavior**
During spidering process, I expected that ZAP would request `main_page/secret.html` and process the response.

**Software versions**
 - ZAP: 2.7.0
 - OS: Linux

**Additional context**
If I use `core/accessUrl` method and then spider from the UI (not the web UI) it will crawl `main_page/secret.html`, process it and add `main_page/more_secrets.html` in URL tree.
If my explanation is unclear, I can make a script to build the website structure.

rename.from: API Spider call not taking ImportedUrls as input
rename.to: API Spider call not taking existing URLs as input

body: Tweaked the title to reflect better the issue.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
